title: Data Analyst, DataKind
summary: Developed AutoVal, an end-to-end data science solution for a nonprofit to analyze second-hand car pricing dynamics. Delivered a Power BI dashboard, a machine learning prediction tool, and an insights report.
details: Partnered with a small team to clean and analyze a 1,445-record second-hand automobile dataset, standardizing 11+ features to ensure high-quality inputs for modeling.
Built an end-to-end price prediction model and deployed it using Streamlit, improving pricing realism by engineering key features such as mileage and number of owners.
Created visual dashboards using Power BI and matplotlib, and delivered a concise report summarizing key market insights and pricing trends to teammates and stakeholders.
impact: Delivered a multi-component system under a tight deadline, providing the nonprofit with actionable insights to support individuals navigating the used-car resale market. The dashboard and ML tool improved understanding of pricing patterns across vehicle conditions.
challenges: Handled inconsistent and unstructured data across features such as imperfections, repainting, and ownership categories. Balanced three deliverables—dashboard, ML model, and written report—under a limited timeline, requiring strict prioritization and iterative experimentation.
content: Developed AutoVal, an end-to-end data science solution for a nonprofit to analyze second-hand car pricing dynamics. Cleaned and analyzed a 1,445-record dataset, built a Streamlit-based price prediction model, and created Power BI dashboards summarizing key insights. Delivered actionable findings and improved understanding of pricing patterns.

title: CineMatch: Multi-Model Movie Recommendation System
summary: Built CineMatch, a multi-engine movie recommendation system combining content-based filtering, quiz-based preference gathering, and a hybrid model. The app uses TF-IDF, cosine similarity, and user inputs to generate personalized movie suggestions, with dynamic poster fetching via the OMDb API and a Streamlit-based UI.
details: Implemented TF-IDF vectorization and cosine similarity to build a content-based recommendation engine using movie metadata.
Designed an interactive quiz-based recommender that captures user preferences such as genre, language, and decade.
Developed a hybrid model that merges content similarity with user preferences to improve recommendation accuracy.
Built a fully functional Streamlit application with session state management for smooth multi-step user interactions.
Integrated OMDb API to fetch dynamic movie posters and enhance the user experience.
impact: Delivered a multi-engine recommendation system that provides personalized and engaging movie suggestions. Strengthened understanding of recommendation algorithms, user-centered design, and deploying interactive ML applications.
challenges: Handled sparse and inconsistent movie metadata, tuned TF-IDF parameters and similarity thresholds for meaningful recommendations, and designed a hybrid system that effectively combines content-based and quiz-based filtering. Managed Streamlit session state to maintain user interactions across quiz and recommendation steps.
content: Built CineMatch, a multi-model movie recommendation system using TF-IDF, cosine similarity, and user preference quizzes. Developed a hybrid recommender, integrated OMDb API for dynamic posters, and deployed an interactive Streamlit application with session state management.

title: TheraPlay: Platform for Connection and Growth
summary: Developed TheraPlay, a platform enabling anonymous, supportive connections for individuals facing personal challenges. Features include secure profiles, user matching, real-time chat (voice and text), collaborative drawing, and AI-generated session insights.
details: Implemented a responsive frontend using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to create a clean and intuitive user interface.
Built backend functionality with Node.js, integrating Socket.io for real-time chat and Fabric.js for collaborative drawing.
Implemented Firebase Authentication to ensure secure and private user sign-ins.
Integrated ElevenLabs API for speech-to-text and text-to-speech capabilities, enhancing accessibility.
Connected Perplexity AI to generate optional post-session insights for users.
Designed the full workflow for user matching and interactive sessions, ensuring smooth real-time collaboration and privacy.
impact: Created a safe and engaging platform that enables users to connect anonymously, express themselves creatively, and receive AI-driven insights. Supports emotional well-being and personal growth through interactive, accessible tools.
challenges: Integrated real-time voice/text chat with collaborative drawing while maintaining state consistency. Ensured secure authentication and privacy using Firebase. Combined multiple APIs (ElevenLabs, Perplexity AI) while maintaining a smooth user experience through iterative testing and refinement.
content: Built TheraPlay, a mental health–focused platform with real-time chat, collaborative drawing, and AI-generated insights. Implemented full-stack features using JavaScript, Node.js, Firebase, Socket.io, Fabric.js, and ElevenLabs API to support anonymous, supportive user interactions.

title: Medpill AI: Medicine Verification Tool
summary: Built Medpill AI during Terrahacks to address the global issue of counterfeit medicines. Developed a prototype that verifies medicine authenticity using OCR, embeddings-based similarity search, and scraped reference images.
details: Implemented OCR-based text extraction from medicine images using an OCR API to support authenticity checks.
Designed a verification pipeline combining web-scraped reference images, embeddings, and similarity search to detect counterfeit medicines.
Collaborated with teammates on ideation, testing, and rapid iteration under strict hackathon time constraints.
Integrated multiple technical components into a functional prototype capable of assisting users in verifying medicine authenticity.
impact: Delivered a functional prototype that helps users verify medicines and raises awareness about counterfeit drugs. Strengthened experience in healthcare-focused problem solving, rapid prototyping, and collaborative development.
challenges: Extracting accurate text from diverse medicine images was difficult due to variations in fonts, packaging, and lighting. Designing a reliable verification strategy with limited reference data required creative experimentation. Coordinating tasks under hackathon pressure demanded efficient teamwork and prioritization.
content: Built Medpill AI, a healthcare-focused tool that verifies medicine authenticity using OCR, embeddings, and similarity search. Developed during Terrahacks as a rapid prototype addressing counterfeit drug risks.

title: CoolCucumbers: Insurance Prediction & Risk Assessment App
summary: Developed CoolCucumbers as part of the UWaterloo CS Club Project Program—an application that predicts future insurance prices and helps insurance companies improve risk assessment. The project won Best Pitch for its real-world potential and strong presentation.
details: Scraped and cleaned historical environmental and insurance-related datasets to prepare high-quality inputs for predictive modeling.
Trained machine learning models to estimate future environmental conditions and insurance prices, supporting risk quantification.
Collaborated with teammates to integrate data pipelines, build the MVP, and refine the user-facing components.
Prepared and delivered a compelling pitch to mentors and judges, highlighting the app’s value for both homebuyers and insurers.
impact: Delivered a functional MVP in just 3 weeks, demonstrating strong potential for real-world use in insurance pricing and risk assessment. Winning Best Pitch validated the solution’s impact and the team's ability to execute under tight timelines.
challenges: Balancing academic workload with a fast-paced 3-week development cycle was demanding. Integrating multiple data sources, designing a predictive pipeline, and coordinating tasks across the team required strong planning and communication.
content: Built CoolCucumbers, an insurance prediction and risk assessment app using machine learning and environmental data. Developed as a team project for the UWaterloo CS Club Program and won Best Pitch for its real-world potential.

title: Researcher & Marketing Manager, Physics Pulse
summary: Served as one of the first members of Physics Pulse, contributing to both research and marketing. Created accessible physics content, expanded the brand identity, and strengthened the organization’s online presence through strategic communication and audience engagement.
details: Researched complex physics topics and translated them into engaging, easy-to-understand articles for a general audience.
Collaborated with the Content Creator Team to produce visually appealing and informative educational content.
Managed social media presence by curating posts, interacting with followers, and crafting compelling captions to boost engagement.
Contributed to brand development by updating the logo and refining the visual identity to support organizational growth.
impact: Helped grow Physics Pulse’s online presence, broadened audience engagement with physics content, and strengthened the brand identity of the early-stage organization.
challenges: Translating complex physics topics into accessible content for a general audience. Maintaining consistent social media engagement while coordinating with a distributed content team. Establishing a cohesive brand identity and updating the logo to align with growth goals.
content: Contributed to Physics Pulse as a researcher and marketing manager, creating accessible physics content, managing social media, and strengthening the brand identity of an early-stage science communication organization.

title: Graphic Designer, DAWN
summary: Served as a graphic designer for DAWN, a Toronto-based non-profit focused on combating human trafficking. Created educational and awareness-driven visual content to inform the public, debunk myths, and support advocacy efforts.
details: Designed informative and visually appealing graphics for Instagram and other platforms to support awareness campaigns.
Simplified complex and sensitive information into accessible visual formats while maintaining accuracy and clarity.
Collaborated with team members to align designs with campaign goals, messaging, and organizational branding.
Contributed to the development of consistent visual identity elements across DAWN’s outreach materials.
impact: Enhanced DAWN’s audience engagement and educational outreach by producing compelling visual content. Helped raise public awareness and amplify the organization’s mission to combat human trafficking.
challenges: Balancing creativity with sensitivity due to the serious nature of human trafficking topics. Ensuring visuals remained informative, accurate, and aligned with DAWN’s mission while still being engaging for social media audiences.
content: Created educational and awareness-focused visual content for DAWN, a non-profit combating human trafficking. Designed social media graphics, simplified complex information, and supported advocacy campaigns through strong visual communication.

title: Finance Associate, Focus Youth
summary: Served as a Finance Associate for Focus Youth, supporting fundraising, sponsorship management, and marketing efforts for a large-scale youth event reaching approximately 4,000 high school students. Played a key role in coordinating operations and ensuring successful event execution.
details: Coordinated fundraising activities and secured sponsorships to support event execution and logistics.
Managed a team of 20 members, ensuring tasks were completed efficiently and aligned with event goals.
Liaised with sponsors and stakeholders to maintain strong relationships and guarantee smooth event operations.
Assisted in marketing initiatives to promote the event and engage thousands of high school students.
impact: Secured essential funds and sponsorships that enabled a large-scale youth event to reach thousands of students. Strengthened organizational credibility and engagement through effective coordination and communication.
challenges: Coordinating multiple stakeholders and team members while meeting fundraising goals. Balancing marketing, sponsorship outreach, and operational tasks under tight deadlines to ensure a successful event.
content: Worked as a Finance Associate for Focus Youth, coordinating fundraising, sponsorships, and marketing for a large-scale youth event. Managed a team of 20, liaised with stakeholders, and ensured smooth execution for an event reaching 4,000 students.

title: Part-Time Tutor (Science & Math, Grade 9)
summary: Provided one-on-one tutoring in grade 9 science and math, delivering personalized instruction to strengthen conceptual understanding, academic performance, and problem-solving skills.
details: Developed individualized lesson plans tailored to each student's learning needs and academic goals.
Delivered one-on-one tutoring sessions focused on clarifying concepts, fostering critical thinking, and reinforcing problem-solving strategies.
Monitored student progress and adapted teaching methods to ensure continuous improvement and sustained engagement.
Supported students in building confidence and developing independent learning habits.
impact: Helped students improve academically, including supporting a grade 9 student who progressed from failing to achieving 70% in just 5 weeks. Strengthened students’ conceptual understanding and nurtured independent learning skills.
challenges: Adapting teaching approaches to different learning styles and paces. Ensuring consistent improvement within limited time frames while maintaining student engagement and confidence.
content: Provided personalized tutoring in grade 9 science and math, developing tailored lesson plans, delivering one-on-one instruction, and helping students improve academic performance and problem-solving skills.

title: CrackBig: University Interview Simulator
summary: Developed CrackBig, an AI-driven web application that simulates university interviews, enabling high school students to practice unlimited interview sessions, receive feedback, and build confidence through personalized insights.
details: Built the frontend using React and developed backend services with Node.js to support interview simulation workflows.
Integrated session tracking using React hooks and Node.js to deliver personalized feedback and progress insights for each user.
Managed deployment across Vercel and Render, resolving key API integration issues and documenting fixes for future scalability.
Designed a scalable system architecture capable of handling multiple interview sessions and individualized user experiences.
impact: Delivered a live, AI-driven interview simulation platform that helps students practice and improve their university interview skills. The project continues to evolve with new features and enhancements.
challenges: Setting up video-based interview questions and ensuring smooth playback. Resolving deployment and API integration issues while maintaining reliable session tracking. Designing a scalable system to support multiple sessions and personalized feedback without compromising user experience.
content: Developed CrackBig, an AI-powered university interview simulator built with React and Node.js. Implemented session tracking, resolved deployment and API issues, and created a scalable system to support personalized interview practice for students.

title: Software Developer, Watonomous
summary: Worked on the Watonomous design team, contributing to robotics software development under tight deadlines. Learned C# and ROS2 in one week and implemented core planning functionality for autonomous navigation.
details: Implemented an A*-based path-planning algorithm in C++ to compute obstacle-aware routes from grid maps, supporting dynamic goal updates.
Designed and integrated a modular planning node with real-time data subscriptions, state handling, and periodic replanning within a robotics software stack.
Learned C# and ROS2 fundamentals in one week to support hardware-level programming and testing.
Documented development hurdles and solutions while iteratively improving system reliability.
impact: Successfully implemented core planning functionality and completed the robotics assignment in under a week. Demonstrated rapid skill acquisition, strong problem-solving, and the ability to contribute to real-world autonomous systems.
challenges: Learning C# and ROS2 from scratch within a week while implementing hardware-level functionality. Troubleshooting robot code in real time and ensuring each component worked correctly under tight deadlines.
content: Developed robotics planning components for Watonomous, implementing A* path planning in C++ and integrating a modular planning node with ROS2. Learned C# and ROS2 in one week and contributed to hardware-level programming and testing.
